title: French Art Songs of the Nineteenth-Century
description:
French Art Songs of the Nineteenth-Century: Thirty-Nine Works from Berlioz to Debussy compiled by Philip Hale

GEORGES BIZET 
    Vieille chanson (words by Charles Millevoye) 
    Pastorale (words by Jean-Fran&ccedil;ois Regnard) 
  C&Eacute;CILE CHAMINADE 
    Si j'&eacute;tais jardinier (words by Roger Miles) 
    Tu me dirais (words by Rosemond G&eacute;rard) 
  ERNEST CHAUSSON 
    "Les morts (No. 1 of Chansons de Miarka, Op. 17, words by Jean Richepin)" 
  CLAUDE DEBUSSY 
    "Les cloches (No. 2 of Deux romances, words by Paul Bourget)" 
    "Il pleure dans mon coeur (No. 2 of Ariettes oubli&eacute;es, words by Paul Verlaine)" 
    "Haromonie du soir (No. 2 of Cinq po&egrave;mes de Baudelaire, words by Charles Baudelaire)" 
    La mort des amants (No. 5 of Cinq po&egrave;mes de Baudelaire) 
    Romance (No. 1 of Deux romances to words by Bourget) 
    L'ombre des arbres (No. 3 of Ariettes oubli&eacute;es to words by Verlaine) 
  L&Eacute;O DELIBES 
    Les filles de Cadix (words by Alfred de Musset) 
    Jours pass&eacute;s (words by Armand Silvestre) 
  HENRI DUPARC 
    Extase (words by Jean Lahor) 
    Soupir (words by Armand Sully-Prudhomme) 
  C&Eacute;SAR FRANCK 
    Le mariage des roses (words by Eug&egrave;ne David) 
    Lied (words by Lucien Pat&eacute;) 
  BENJAMIN GODARD 
    Te souviens-tu? (words by composer) 
    Embarquez-vous! (words by Ulrich Guttinguer) 
    L'amour (words by Rose Harel) 
  CHARLES GOUNOD 
    Au printemps (words by Jules Barbier) 
    Medj&eacute;: chanson arabe (words by Jules Barbier) 
    Le vallon (words by Alphonse de Lamartine) 
  REYNALDO HAHN 
    "L'heure exquise (No. 5 of Chansons grises, words by Paul Verlaine)" 
    Si mes vers avaient des ailes! (words by Victor Hugo) 
  VINCENT D'INDY 
    "Madrigal dans le style ancien (Op. 4, words by Robert de Bonni&egrave;res)" 
    "Lied maritime (Op. 43, words by composer)" 
  JULES MASSENET 
    Chant proven&ccedil;al (words by Michel Carr&eacute;) 
    Ouvre tes yeux bleux (words by Paul Robiquet) 
    Que l'heure est donc br&egrave;ve (words by Armand Silvestre) 
  GABRIEL PIERN&Eacute; 
    S&eacute;r&eacute;nade (Op. 7; words by Eug&egrave;ne Adenis) 
  CAMILLE SAINT-SA&Euml;NS 
    La cloche (words by Victor Hugo) 
    Clair de lune (words by Catulle Mend&egrave;s) 
  AMBROISE THOMAS 
    Le soir (words by Michel Carr&eacute;) 
  CHARLES-MARIE WIDOR 
    Soupir (words by Th&eacute;ophile Gautier)
